sub_title: (M.Sc.) Applied Social Psychology | Project Manager Verso Academy
summary:
I recently graduated as a social psychologist from the University of Groningen where I pursued a Master's degree in Applied Social Psychology. 

In my podcast "Climate Psychology" I talk about the intersection between psychology and the climate crisis! My goals is to not onyl educate people about climate psychology but to also engage the audience in the topics and facilitate action. 

Building on my interests in behaviour change, sustainability, climate adaptation, environmental, and social psychology, I have pursued an internship as junior researcher at the Innovatiewerkplaats (IWP) of the Hanze University of Applied Sciences. My project focussed on conducting research on engaging citizens in climate adaptative measures. As an end-product I developed an advisory report on climate adaptive measures and citizen engagement for the municipality of Groningen.

Furthermore, until February 2021 I was in the in the Youth for Climate Adaptation (YfCA) team, which organizes the Climate Adaptation Youth Summit during the Climate Adaptation Week 2021. Within the YfCA, I was a coordinator keeping track of assignments and the main goals of the Youth Summit. Working with youth and being part of something big like this was an amazing opportunity. 

Since 2015, I have been an alumnus of the Foundation Bildung & Begabung that I have worked for as project manager of the projects "Why is climate mitigation and adaptation so difficult for us?" and many more. Working in the field of education and being part of a changing and evolving education system is one of my passions and I would not miss working with youth for the world. 

If you are interested in my podcast, my experience or you just simply want to connect feel free to drop me a message!

treasury_media.title: Climate Psychology Podcast by Hannah
treasury_media.description:
Listen to my podcast "Climate Psychology" on Spotify. 

If you're interested in the psychology of climate change, social psychology, environmental psychology and how it all relates to climate change, I've got something for you! So far available on Spotify and Anchor.

Tune in, if you want to know how important insights into psychology are in order to find solutions to the climate crisis!

treasury_media.title: Talkshow "Draait de Wereld Door" Climate Adaptation Week 2021
treasury_media.description: This is the recording of the Talkshow "Draait de Wereld Door" by Climate Adaptation Groningen which was part of the Climate Adaptation Week 2021. During this talk show, I had the extraordinary opportunity to present my opinions and insights on citizen engagement in climate adaptation.

treasury_media.title: Climate Adaptation Workshop
treasury_media.description: This is the recording of the Climate Adaptation workshop by Floris Boogaard which was held during the Climate Adaptation Week 2021 in Groningen. I had the honor to be live and talk about the psychology of climate adaptation and represent my colleagues Thomas, Joeri, Tjerk Jan and Snow with whom I have worked incredibly hard during our research internship at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences.

treasury_media.title: Symposium on Climate Adaptation
treasury_media.description: During the Innivationlab on Climate Adaptation I worked together with multiple students from the Hanze University of Applied Sciences on different research projects. On this website you will find an overview of the different presentations. My project was representing research in Climate Adaptation & Behaviour and I welcome you to have a look!

treasury_media.title: Climate Adaptation Week 2021 Groningen
treasury_media.description: "2020 is internationally declared as the year of action. This year is intended to bring people together and take joint actions against climate change.". As coordinator of the Youth for Climate Adaptation (YfCA) team I help to organize events and raise awareness for the Climate Adaptation Youth Summit 2021 which is part of the Climate Adaptation Week 2021.

certifications.name: Making Climate Adaptation Happen: Governing Transformation Strategies for Climate Change

(M.Sc.) Applied Social Psychology | Project Manager Verso Academy

profile_positions.description:
My main areas of responsibility included the following: 
• Project and Content Management of the courses: Mission Sustainability, Climate Action Communication, Social Sustainability, Sustainable Cosmetics,
• Content Development/Design: Climate Change and Climate Action, Mission Sustainability, Climate Action Communication, Social Sustainability, 
• Translating of various materials including marketing materials, materials for XU, and
materials for the School of Sustainability from English to German and German to English
• Serving as a Trust Partner for colleagues of the Berlin office and CP-wide, helping them deal with and solve work-related issues
• Establishing a companywide glossary of climate-change related terms and publishing a confluence page for internal use
• Giving a workshop about science and climate change communication during the CP Learning & Sharing day
• Holding newbie presentations about the School of Sustainability
profile_positions.title: Content Manager E-Learning and Climate Action

profile_positions.description: Most of us are aware that climate change is one of the biggest problems our society is facing in the 21st century. I believe that only through collective action based on social scientific insights and adaptive behaviours, we will be able to avoid severe negative consequences of climate change. For this, we need insights into the psychology of climate change.
profile_positions.title: Podcast Host "Climate Psychology"

profile_positions.description: As a project assistant, I supported the adelphi research team with my literature review skills and gathered secondary data to help create a sound theoretical framework for the topic of climate risk and vulnerability analyses.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant "Climate Risk and Vulnerability Analyses"

profile_positions.description:
In my role as project manager for the project "Why is climate mitigation and adaptatioon so difficult for us -and what can we do about it?" I managed and organized an 8-day summer school for the Talent Akademie (Engl. talent academy.) in which my colleague Tabea Hosak and I helped ten 12-15-year-olds to understand the complex interrelationships of our global society in the context of the climate crisis. During the project, we dived into the depths of environmental and social psychology, as well as political and sociological concepts. In discussions, quizzes, presentations, experiments, films and a role- game, the youth acquired a basic understanding of the climate crisis and the socio-psycho-political challenges we are facing as consequences. Together we developed possible solutions on a personal, social, and political level and reflected on our lifestyle. 

The aims of the project are the funding of personality development, cognitive and non-cognitive skills, creativity and key competencies. It helps the youth to recognize their own talents and opportunities and activate resources.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager  "Why is climate mitigation and adaptation so difficult for us?"

profile_positions.description: In July 2021 I was invited as a guest speaker for a seminar at the Youth Education Centre of St. Michaelturm in Germany. This Education Centre offers youth to take free seminars and classes during their voluntary social gap year which is organized by the Bundesfreiwlligendienst (Engl: German Federal Voluntary Service). During the interactive, digital seminar, I taught young adults from the ages of 17 to 19 all about the climate crisis and the intersections between climate adaptation and psychology.
profile_positions.title: Guest Speaker on Climate Psychology and Adaptation

profile_positions.description: As a psychology tutor for Athena Studies my task in March entailed planning, organizing, preparing and executing a 3-hour exam preparation course for eight psychology students from the Radboud University in Nijmegen on the topic of theoretical psychology.
profile_positions.title: Psychology Tutor

company.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

profile_positions.company: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen
profile_positions.description:
As an intern at the Innovatiewerkplaats (IWP) Climate Adaptation I worked together in a multidisciplinary team on projects related to climate adaptation.

The specific project that I was working on was focused on researching the engagement of citizens in climate adaptation in Paddepoel, Groningen, from a social-psychological perspective. 

To conclude my internship I wrote an advisory report for the municipality of Groningen (Gemeente Groningen) and the Waterschap Noorderzijlvest (WNZV) on ways the municipality of Groningen can facilitate climate action and climate adaptive behaviours amongst citizens.
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher - Citizen Engagement in Climate Adaptation

profile_positions.description:
On June, 18th I was given the opportunity by Bildung & Begabung to lead and host a workshop about mindfulness for teenagers during times of Covid-19. 

During this 3-hour workshop, I guided 20 teenagers from the ages of 15 to 17 from the basics of mindfulness towards trying out mindfulness exercises that they can implement in their everyday life that we afterwards reflected on. 

The workshop focused on relaxation, trying out new things, self-reflection and sharing oneself with the group in a non-judgmental way. Furthermore, the focus lied on the importance of mindfulness during times of Covid-19 and how they can benefit from mindfulness. 

It was a great pleasure and a lot of fun to see so many young, open-minded and wonderful people participating with curiosity and patience.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - Mindfulness

profile_positions.description:
As part of an annual 2-week talent-academy, I co-led the project "Positive Psychology" for students aged 12 to 16. The goal of this project was to teach and coach students regarding the topic of positive psychology in an engaging way, thereby enabling them to translate their learnings into tangible mini-projects focused on psychology.

Responsibilities and outcomes included:
- preparing materials and games for 2-6 hours a day of student activities on the topic of psychology
- teaching positive psychology and coaching students through the process of developing their own projects in view of a final presentation to a 60+ member audience 
- facilitating student engagement, group activities and team-strengthening 
- monitoring and evaluating projects throughout and after the talent-academy
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - Positive Psychology

volunteer_experiences.role: Community Outreach Coordinator and Behaviour Change Researcher
volunteer_experiences.description: Together with other self-motivated volunteers, I helped the Green Revolution Foundation to find effective ways to engage citizens in their mission, conduct market research and use my knowledge as social psychologist to find effective ways of communication.

volunteer_experiences.role: Coordinator within the Youth for Climate Adaptation (YfCA) team
volunteer_experiences.description: As a coordinator, I and 5 other motivated young members of the YfCA work closely together with the project managers of the Climate Adaptation Youth Summit (CAYS) in 2021. We ensure that assignments are being picked up by the members of the YfCA, that deadlines are respected and that working in project-groups goes smoothly overall.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Youth for Climate Adaptation (YfCA) team
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Climate Adaptation Youth Summit (CAYS) is part of the Climate Adaptation Week 2021 in Groningen.

Being part of the YfCA team, I will help to ensure that everyone in The Netherlands has heard about what happens during the CAYS and plan activities for prior, during and after the CAYS. In a team of a diverse and motivated group of young internationals, I help to develop content for the message that we as youth want to spread. Next to developing content, we are in charge of organising activities that raise awareness about climate change.

During my time as sustainability ambassador of the Green Office Groningen, I joined the group as an active member of the Event Committee and part of the event team for the plastic-free week of the University of Groningen

As the chair of the Information Committee of the Green Office Groningen, I am in charge of managing the committee's activities, planning committee meetings, being in close touch with the board of the Green Office and monitoring and evaluating events.

volunteer_experiences.role: Student Year Representative Applied Social Psychology

volunteer_experiences.description:
As an alumnus of the foundation Bildung & Begabung,I am part of the network and can help out whenever there is a need for a project manager, academy manager or other tasks within the organisation.

In 2015 I was selected to take part in the annual talent-academy based on my academic achievements and extracurricular engagement which brings together students from all over Germany.

volunteer_experiences.role: Content Creator for the Poster Committee

volunteer_experiences.description: As a volunteer from the student network of the Pestalozzi-Highschool in Unna I was in charge of organizing an event for Syrian refugees in the area. Together with other students and political organizations it was my role to organize, host and plan a refugee Cafe in our city.
